intro: Poicillopsis tuerckheimii, commonly known as the Tuerckheim's poicillopsis, is a rare and specialized algal genus found in freshwater environments. It belongs to the order Picochlorales and is characterized by its small, unicellular structure. The organism is typically found in nutrient-rich, oligotrophic waters, where it plays a minor but ecologically significant role. Its morphology includes a spherical cell with a distinct chloroplast and a nucleus, typical of many green algae. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is of interest to researchers studying aquatic biodiversity and environmental health.
